markdownRemark.html:
As the world is rapidly evolving, I honestly believe that my home country is not being able to adapt to the current trends. Take a look at this problems..

  • It is estimated that the country loses 3.5 billion pesos (66 million USD) in traffic everyday.

  • Degredation of natural resources is already affecting human lives. Soil erosion killed 90 people and others missing in two separate locations in a span of a week.

  • A 2016 study shows that as a country, we are producing students incapable of adopting to the future.

  • Food supply have been an issue in the recent months. Rice shortage is a three year high.

These problems have plagued our generation for the last decade and shows evidence that we are not coping with the growing population and degredation of natural resources. As the population gets bigger and bigger, it then magnifies the problem leading to more loses in time and opportunity.

To start, most of my fellow countrymen think that technology is a costly endeavor and we cannot afford it. But as history portrayed our improvements in day to day living … I should say that I would like to think that technology is a “mindset”. Besides, using old solutions to old problems will always have the same outcome. Innovation is a must if we want long lasting improvement for the next generations to come.

I applaud the current government for its accomplishment in solving some of our problems but still I see that even the government is very slow to adapt new solutions being used in other countries. Sadly, the way for new laws to be implemented..it takes a lot of time. A large part of congress also have their self-interests are first prioritize instead of the nation.

Google, Apple and other companies have already declared that they don’t need a degree for certain professions to hire.
